post.content:
Rare’s cancelled Xbox Live Arcade remaster of its seminal N64 shooter GoldenEye 007 has been published in its entirety with a two-hour playthrough video.

The video below, published on the YouTube channel of GoldenEye 007 hiss material creator Graslu00 (by means of GoldenEye File), reveals the paunchy sport done on the OO Agent concern in 4k resolution and 60 frames-per-second, with 30 minutes of multiplayer at the kill. The photos reveals GoldenEye 007 XBLA running on an emulator to cease the increased resolution.

In 2007 Microsoft-owned Rare developed an HD remaster of its N64 traditional to be launched on XBLA, but copyright disputes seen the project shuttered. Earlier than this video, simplest 30 minutes of photos of the game had been launched. Now we explore the game in all its glory – from its iconic opening Dam degree to its final bonus degree Egyptian – all with an acceptable framerate!

In a tweet, Graslu00 insisted this gameplay is no longer linked to any recent leak. Somewhat, builds of the game were obtained years ago from PartnerNet, a sandbox model of Xbox Live obtainable simplest to dev equipment owners. Per Graslu00, a create of the game could per chance be launched at some level in 2021.

Whereas the XBLA remaster by no methodology seen the sunshine of day, we did at final salvage a paunchy remake on the Wii with the identically-titled GoldenEye 007 in 2010. This model, developed by Eurocom and published by Activision, became later given an HD port on Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 as GoldenEye 007: Reloaded in 2011.
